title: US, China Near TikTok Deal, Trump and Xi to Finalize Soon
snippets: US President Donald Trump and his Chinese counterpart Xi Jinping could finalize the deal on the Chinese-owned video platform TikTok in the coming days.
Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent, in Madrid for trade talks with China, said on Monday they have "a framework for a TikTok deal."
The U.S. and China have a 'framework' deal for social media platform TikTok in place, Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said Monday.
US president says talks with Beijing have ‘gone very well’ and plans call with Xi Jinping this week

Framework agreement is a breakthrough in long-running dispute over TikTok’s ownership amid security concerns in Washington

  • Business live
titles: US says it reached 'framework' TikTok deal with China
Trump admin live updates: Bessent says 'framework' for TikTok deal has been reached
Bessent: TikTok deal 'framework' reached with China, Trump and Xi will finalize it Friday
Trump signals US and China have struck TikTok deal
US and China reach deal to transfer TikTok ownership, trade official says
summary: US President Donald Trump and Chinese President Xi Jinping are nearing a deal on TikTok, as announced by Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent. They have established a 'framework' agreement aimed at resolving the long-standing dispute over the video platform's ownership due to security concerns. Bessent, speaking from Madrid, noted the progress during trade talks with China. Trump also mentioned that discussions have been successful and anticipates a call with Xi Jinping within the week to finalize the agreement.

title: US-China Officials Discuss Trade, TikTok Sale in Madrid Amid Chip Probes
snippets: U.S. officials have announced a "framework" that would let Chinese-owned short video platform TikTok continue operations in the United States, although the two countries are still working out the details.
Top economic officials met in Madrid for a second day, with deadlines looming on tariffs and a ban on TikTok in the United States if it is not sold by its Chinese owner, ByteDance.
Economic officials meeting in Madrid are seeking to head off a November tariff deadline.

The US and China have reached a “framework” deal to divest TikTok from its Chinese parent company, Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent told reporters during trade talks in Madrid on Monday. As noted by Reuters, Bessent confirmed that “the framework is for a switch to a U.S.-controlled ownership.”

The "framework" deal with China is
"between two private parties, but the commercial terms have been agreed upon," CNBC quoted Bessent as saying on the sidelines of a meeting between the two countries in Madrid on Monday.
titles: Officials announce a 'framework' for keeping TikTok online in the U.S.
U.S., China Conclude Talks With ‘Framework’ on TikTok Sale
U.S. and China Resume Talks on Tariffs and TikTok
The US and China might finally have a TikTok deal
US, China reach ‘framework’ deal for TikTok
summary: Senior US and China officials are meeting in Madrid to address trade issues and the approaching TikTok sale deadline. Concurrently, China has initiated probes into US chip practices. They aim to prevent tariffs set for November. The US has extended TikTok's deadline to find a non-Chinese buyer to September 17, to avoid a ban.

title: Duplantis Sets Pole Vault World Record at 6.30m in Tokyo
snippets: Armand Duplantis breaks the men's pole vault world record for the 14th time, clearing 6.30m attempt after winning gold at the World Athletics Championships in Tokyo.
Armand Duplantis breaks the men's pole vault world record for the 14th time, clearing 6.30m attempt after winning gold at the World Athletics Championships in Tokyo.
Sweden's Armand 'Mondo' Duplantis sails over the bar to set 14th pole vault record at the World Athletic Championships.

• Swede clears 6.30m to claim gold in Tokyo

  • Shoes with metal spike enable faster run-up

The pole vault competition was already two hours and 20 minutes old when Mondo Duplantis finally got serious at these World Athletics Championships. The bar had just been r
Sweden's Armand Duplantis broke the men's pole vault world record for a 14th time on his way to gold at the World Athletics Championships in Tokyo.
Armand “Mondo” Duplantis broke the pole-vault world record for the 14th time Monday night, clearing 6.30 metres to capture his third world championship.
titles: 'What a legend!' - Duplantis clears 6.30m to break pole vault world record
'What a legend!' Duplantis clears 6.30m to break world record
Duplantis breaks pole vault world record to win gold in Tokyo
Mondo Duplantis hits new heights with ‘Claw’ after 14th pole vault world record
Duplantis breaks pole vault world record for 14th time
Sweden’s Mondo Duplantis crushes own pole-vault world record to capture gold
summary: Armand Duplantis of Sweden set a new men's pole vault world record, clearing 6.30 meters at the World Athletics Championships in Tokyo. This marks his 14th world record and secured him a gold medal. His achievement was facilitated by shoes with metal spikes, enhancing his run-up.

title: Bengals' Joe Burrow to Miss 3 Months for Toe Surgery After Jaguars Game
snippets: Bengals QB Joe Burrow will need toe surgery that will sideline him a minimum of three months, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter.
Burrow went down injured against the Jacksonville Jaguars, and Jake Browning stepped up to finish the game.
Cincinnati Bengals quarterback Joe Burrow is expected to miss at least three months because of a toe injury, according to media reports on Monday.
titles: Sources: Burrow needs toe surgery, out 3 months
Bengals QB Joe Burrow to have toe surgery, expected to miss at least three months
AP Source: QB Joe Burrow to miss three months after toe injury
summary: Cincinnati Bengals quarterback Joe Burrow is set to undergo toe surgery, sidelining him for at least three months following an injury sustained against the Jacksonville Jaguars. Jake Browning replaced him for the remainder of the game.

title: Trump Proposes Biannual Financial Reporting for U.S. Companies
snippets: <a href="https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMiiAFBVV95cUxNRDhWMkwxbldLODNkVzFKdTJrUmFSdkxkbDlral94X0EyWXpLelYyQXJEYmtRMURiMy1TUmIyYkpKQ0hWUmlqSXVJR2VySmE2SFkwbWdCbVZOODFrXzNyYnRGaTBNc0ZfaTM1TmtfNWU2Q3otRG5SRlo5dEwzZVh0dHJQY0ZrWm05?oc=5" target="_blank">Trump says public companies shouldn't have

European companies already report twice yearly. Trump wants to allow U.S. businesses to do the same.
titles: Trump says public companies shouldn't have to report quarterly anymore - Axios
Trump calls for US companies to ditch quarterly reporting
Trump revives call to ditch quarterly earnings reports. What comes next?
summary: President Trump has stated that he believes U.S. public companies should not be required to disclose their financials every quarter, suggesting a shift to a biannual reporting system similar to that of European companies.

title: China Finds Nvidia's Mellanox Buyout Violates Anti-Monopoly Laws
snippets: China's market regulator on Monday said that Nvidia violated the country's anti-monopoly law in relation to its aquisition of Mellanox in 2020.
The chipmaker has increasingly found itself caught up in a tug of war between Washington and Beijing.
Regulator’s statement comes as US and Chinese officials meet in Madrid for trade talks.
titles: China says Nvidia violated anti-monopoly law after preliminary probe
China says Nvidia violated antitrust laws as it ratchets up pressure ahead of U.S. trade talks
China rules that Nvidia violated its antitrust laws
summary: China's market regulator declared on Monday that Nvidia breached the nation's anti-monopoly laws through its 2020 acquisition of Mellanox. This development occurs amidst escalating tensions between the US and China, with both countries' officials currently engaged in trade discussions in Madrid.

title: Blue Jays Veteran Sets Stage for Rookie Yesavage's Debut
snippets: Another big outing from one of the Toronto Blue Jays' oldest players has set the stage for the newest.

Sho Alli and Julia Kreuz discuss the expectations for debuting Toronto Blue Jays pitcher Trey Yesavage, including the Jays positioning him as a starter and why they could use the extra innings Yesavage could provide.
titles: Springer helps Jays sweep before Yesavage debut
What are Blue Jays’ expectations for Yesavage in debut and beyond?
summary: A veteran Toronto Blue Jays player's recent performance has paved the way for rookie pitcher Trey Yesavage's debut. Analysts Sho Alli and Julia Kreuz talked about the team's decision to use Yesavage as a starter, highlighting the need for additional innings he could offer.

title: Spain's PM Calls for Israel Ban from Sports Events After Vuelta Disruption
snippets: Spain's prime minister called for Israel to be banned from international sporting events after pro-Palestinian activists disrupted the Spanish Vuelta cycling race.

Speaking after Gaza protesters forced early end to cycle race, Pedro Sánchez says Israel should not be allowed to use sports to ‘whitewash’ its ‘barbarism’

Spain’s prime minister, Pedro Sánchez, has called for Israel to be barred from international sports competitions for as long as its “ba
titles: Spain's prime minister calls for Israel sports ban
Spain’s PM calls for Israel to be banned from sports events after Gaza protests force end to Vuelta race
summary: Spain's Prime Minister, Pedro Sánchez, advocated for banning Israel from international sporting events, following the disruption of the Spanish Vuelta cycling race by pro-Palestinian activists. Sánchez criticized Israel's actions in Gaza and accused the country of using sports to 'whitewash' its conduct. This statement was made in the context of protests that led to an early conclusion of the cycling event.

title: Browning Leads Bengals to Victory After Burrow Injury
snippets: Jake Browning helped deliver a win to the Bengals on Sunday, but what's reasonable to expect from the backup?
On Sept. 14, Joe Burrow suffered an injury during the second quarter of the matchup between the Cincinnati Bengals and Jacksonville Jaguars
titles: Joe Burrow out with turf toe: What is it, and what will 3 months away mean for the QB, Bengals?
Will Joe Burrow Return This Season? What We Know About the Cincinnati Bengals Quarterback's Turf Toe Injury
summary: Jake Browning stepped in as quarterback for the Cincinnati Bengals after Joe Burrow was injured in the second quarter of the game against the Jacksonville Jaguars on Sept. 14. Browning's performance contributed to a Bengals win.

title: Warriors' Roster Moves Await Kuminga's Decision on Extended Offer
snippets: Kuminga's future with the Warriors will determine how the team fills its remaining roster spots as training camp nears.
The Warriors reportedly added a year to their offer, but Kuminga still balked at the idea of a team option
titles: Inside the Warriors' stalemate with Jonathan Kuminga
Jonathan Kuminga contract: Warriors forward rejects latest offer from front office in stalemate, per report
summary: The Golden State Warriors' decision on filling their remaining roster spots hinges on Jonathan Kuminga's future with the team. As training camp approaches, the Warriors have reportedly extended their offer by adding an additional year, but Kuminga has yet to accept, objecting to the inclusion of a team option.

title: Arab, Muslim Leaders Meet in Doha Over Israel's Gaza Strike
snippets: Arab and Muslim leaders are meeting in Doha for an emergency summit after Israel’s unprecedented attack on the city.
At a summit in the Qatari capital, Doha, participants are deciding whether to take tangible actions against Israel following last week’s strike.
Arab foreign ministers gathered on Sunday in the Qatari capital, Doha, to lay the groundwork for a summit there the next day.
titles: Arab and Muslim leaders gather in Doha after Israeli attack
Arab Leaders Meet to Weigh Response to Israel’s Attack in Qatar
Arab Ministers Meet on Response to Israeli Attack in Qatar
summary: Arab and Muslim leaders convened in Doha for an emergency summit to discuss responses to Israel's recent attack on Gaza. The meeting aimed to decide on concrete actions following the strike. Arab foreign ministers met in Doha prior to the summit to prepare for the discussions.

title: Sierra CEO Sees AI Bubble as Positive, Foresees Economic Transformation
snippets: Sierra CEO Bret Taylor also said like the dotcom bubble, AI will “transform the economy” and create massive economic value.
Like OpenAI CEO Sam Altman, Bret Taylor thinks we're in an AI bubble — but he doesn't sound too worried about it.
titles: OpenAI board chair doubles down on CEO Sam Altman’s belief we’re in an AI bubble: ‘A lot of people will lose a lot of money’
OpenAI board chair Bret Taylor says we’re in an AI bubble (but that’s okay)
summary: Sierra CEO Bret Taylor, echoing OpenAI CEO Sam Altman, acknowledges the presence of an AI bubble but views it positively, suggesting AI will significantly transform the economy and create substantial economic value.

title: Investigation Underway in Charlie Kirk Murder, Suspect Uncooperative
snippets: Authorities say the suspect in the Charlie Kirk murder investigation is not cooperating. However, the people around him are. Here's what we know. And, takeaways from the 2025 Emmys.
A family member says he had turned political recently and hated Kirk. But Robinson's family is staunchly Republican.
titles: What we know about the suspect arrested in Charlie Kirk's killing. And, Emmy takeaways
Charlie Kirk killing: What we know about suspect Tyler Robinson’s motives
summary: Authorities are investigating the murder of Charlie Kirk, with the suspect currently not cooperating. However, individuals associated with the suspect are providing assistance. A family member revealed the suspect had recently become politically motivated and harbored animosity towards Kirk, despite the suspect's family being strongly Republican. The current status of the investigation or any additional details about the 2025 Emmys were not provided.

title: Tesla Shares Surge 8% as Musk Buys $1bn Stock, Targets 25% Ownership
snippets:
Tesla shares rose by more than 8% after news of CEO’s transactions, a week after he was offered $1tn pay package

Elon Musk, the Tesla CEO, has purchased nearly $1bn wort
Elon Musk slightly boosted his ownership of Tesla to 12.8%, making a small step toward the 25% target he outlined last year.
Tesla's share price rose roughly 6% in premarket trading on Monday after an SEC filing revealed Musk's purchase.
titles: Elon Musk buys nearly $1bn in Tesla stock in push for more control
Elon Musk just spent $1 billion on Tesla shares. He'll have to spend a lot more to ramp up his control.
Elon Musk buys $1 billion worth of Tesla shares as he looks to gain more control over the EV maker
summary: Tesla shares increased by over 8% following CEO Elon Musk's purchase of nearly $1bn worth of Tesla stock, raising his ownership to 12.8%. This move came shortly after he was offered a $1tn pay package. The purchase, aiming towards a 25% ownership goal stated last year, led to a 6% rise in Tesla's share price in premarket trading after the SEC filing was disclosed.

title: JD Vance to Host "The Charlie Kirk Show" in Tribute to Friend on Monday
snippets: JD Vance takes the mic to host "The Charlie Kirk Show" Monday
'I will have the honor of hosting the Charlie Kirk Show. Please join me as I pay tribute to my friend,' Vance wrote on X.

JD Vance hosting return episode of Charlie Kirk podcast
summary: JD Vance announced he will host "The Charlie Kirk Show" on Monday, inviting people to join him in paying tribute to his friend. This news was shared by Vance on the social media platform X.

title: Pro-Palestinian Protests Lead to Cancellation of Vuelta's Final Day
snippets: Pro-Palestinian protesters forced Spain’s Vuelta cycling race to be abandoned on its final day.
The final day of the three-week long Vuelta a España came to a premature end as pro-Palestinian protesters blocked streets.
titles: How protests over Israeli team ended Spain’s Vuelta cycling race
Protests Against an Israeli Cycling Team Shut Down a Major Race
summary: Pro-Palestinian protesters caused the cancellation of Spain's Vuelta cycling race's final day. The three-week-long event ended prematurely due to the street blockades by the demonstrators.

Trump insists foreign workers are ‘welcome’ days after arrest of hundreds of South Koreans

He emphasized not wanting to "disincentivize investment" following the incident, which had caused widespread alarm in South Korea.

title: Zelensky: Russian Drone Incursion Marks War Expansion; NATO Airspace Breached
snippets: <a href="https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMieEFVX3lxTFBxVGVYR2JyeW9ORDF0bXIySXVmYi10TF9sYzVLS0stR1pvQmhRZXlGaEdMWTBBUFhlWnlkZUJOeFpYMi13dmZadjJzdTFyaXJZY09FYnhSZlZpR1pvSDFzMnJSM3NCdEV0OURaNDNvMTlkMVBTTExVRw?oc=5" target="_blank">Romania 2nd NATO nation in a week to report Russian drone in its
It was the second time in less than a week that a Russian drone had flown through a NATO member’s airspace. Last week, NATO scrambled fighter jets to shoot down Russian drones in Polish airspace.
titles: Romania 2nd NATO nation in a week to report Russian drone in its airspace - Axios
Romania Says Russian Drone Entered Its Airspace
summary: Ukraine's President Zelensky described a recent Russian drone incursion as an expansion of the war. This incident marks the second time in less than a week that Russian drones have entered NATO airspace, with NATO jets previously intercepting drones in Polish airspace.
